intro: Traunsteinera globosa, commonly known as the globe hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, globe-shaped inflorescence composed of numerous small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Traunsteinera globosa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
